summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from 2020-2021 between Gary Stein, a partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP, and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding scheduling a call and a subpoena for records from the Professional Children's School (PCS) related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions, specifically third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships from 1997 to 2000.

persons.name: Gary Stein
persons.role: Partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP
persons.context: Attorney communicating with a federal prosecutor regarding a subpoena for records from the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions.

persons.name: Elizabeth Sullivan
persons.context: Federal prosecutor copied on emails, involved in the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's financial records at the Professional Children's School.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of a subpoena for records of third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships at the Professional Children's School from 1997 to 2000.

connections.description: Correspondence regarding a legal matter (subpoena for records) between a private attorney and a federal prosecutor.
Gary Stein, as a lawyer, is involved in communications regarding a subpoena for records related to Jeffrey Epstein's financial transactions.

events.title: Period of financial transactions under investigation
events.description: Time period for which prosecutors are seeking records of third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships at the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Prosecutor's follow-up query on Epstein records
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emails Gary Stein to ask if the Professional Children's School has any records of third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships for Jeffrey Epstein from 1997-2000, indicating an active investigation.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was investigating financial transactions related to Jeffrey Epstein at the Professional Children's School (PCS).
The investigation sought records of third-party payments, donations, or sponsored scholarships for Epstein from 1997 to 2000.
Gary Stein, a partner at the law firm Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP, was the point of contact for the school regarding the subpoena.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination in 2021 to schedule a call between Stein and prosecutors to discuss the records request.
The document indicates the investigation into Epstein's activities extended to his financial support of institutions.
